task_summary: Grasp the fridge handle and open the hinged door, then retreat to a safe distance.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 robot approaches a closed fridge, locates the handle, aligns its gripper, grasps using a pulling strategy, and opens the hinged door before retreating. The scene shows a domestic-style fridge beside drawers, with the robotâ€™s arm operating from the right side. The plan prioritizes reliable detection, stable grasping, and a single decisive door-opening action using an abstract OpenContainer node. Safety includes verifying grasp stability and a short retreat after the door swings open.
preconditions: Fridge is reachable by the manipulator
Hinged door operates freely without obstructions
Fridge handle is visible or discoverable via scanning
Robot has control authority over gripper and arm
stepwise_plan: Scan and detect the fridge handle
Pre-open gripper and compute a pull grasp
Align to the handle and set gripper yaw
Close gripper and verify grasp stability
If not already open, execute door opening for a hinged door
success_criteria: Door is detected to be open
End effector retreats to a safe offset
failure_and_recovery: Handle not detected: re-scan or adjust viewpoint
Grasp slip: reopen, realign, and regrasp
Door jammed: apply a second open attempt after re-aligning
Unexpected collision: stop, retreat, and replan
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the fridge reports open and the robot has retreated to a safe distance.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Position the robot near the fridge.
Search for the handle using a raster scan.
Compute a pulling grasp for the handle.
Precisely align end effector to the handle.
Orient gripper to match handle orientation.
Secure the handle with moderate force.
Check if the fridge is already open.
Back off to a safe distance after opening.
Short pause to let the door settle.

failure_modes: Handle not detected due to occlusion or lighting
Misalignment causing failed closure on handle
Door hinge resistance exceeding expected torque
Collision with adjacent cabinet during swing
recovery_strategy: Re-scan with raster pattern and adjust viewpoint
Recompute grasp and re-approach with tighter tolerance
Attempt a second open after slight repositioning
Abort and retreat if contact forces spike
assumptions: The door is a standard right-hinged fridge door with a bar handle
Yaw 90 degrees aligns gripper with the handle axis
Contact sheet depicts progression from closed to fully open
Spec lists 9 frames, despite a separate note elsewhere referencing 8; this plan uses all 9 frames
